New Records: Francisco Lindor connected for two postseason grand slams
Carlos Estévez recorded his first postseason save
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning
Edwin Díaz struck out Kyle Schwarber with two runners aboard to end the game
The Mets put three runners on in the sixth with nobody out, leading to a grand slam by Francisco Lindor
Pre-Game Insights: Owner Steve Cohen expressed his desire to slay negative Met fan perceptions
Manager Rob Thomson acknowledged the team's disappointment but praised their effort
Post-Match Reflections: Players expressed pride in the team's resilience and future prospects
The Mets are now preparing for the NLCS against the San Diego Padres or Los Angeles Dodgers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a sold-out crowd of 44,103
This was the Mets' first playoff series win at Citi Field in 24 years
Others: The Phillies were eliminated from the playoffs
The Mets are chasing their third World Series title since 1986
